summary: Build a professional website to sell Binance Gift Cards (USDT values $500–$50,000) and accept payments in Bitcoin.
architectural_notes: Introduce a configurable pricing multiplier/discount (e.g., 0.5) used when calculating the BTC amount shown in payment instructions.
Add owner-only access control for the admin panel (authentication + authorization).
Use a real-time BTC conversion source for USDT→BTC calculation (and ensure the same rate/logic is used consistently anywhere BTC equivalents are displayed).
Admin panel route may be /admin/orders (not /admin); ensure routing/404 handling is consistent and documented.
known_issues: Checkout flow bug: clicking 'Create order' / 'Get payment instructions' does not display Bitcoin payment instructions (e.g., BTC address/payment details) to the user.
BTC equivalent for the half-price (e.g., $250) is not being converted using a real-time exchange rate; displayed BTC amount is stale/incorrect.
Catalog/product cards are displaying an incorrect BTC equivalent for the 50% price (e.g., user expects ~$250 ≈ 0.0037 BTC) — conversion logic/rate is not matching current market rate used elsewhere.
Admin access control bug: site owner is receiving “Access Denied” when trying to access the admin panel via Internet Identity (likely owner principal mismatch or env/config issue).
Admin route discovery issue: visiting /admin returns “Not found”; admin panel appears to be mounted at /admin/orders instead of /admin.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, professional marketing + storefront experience for selling Binance Gift Cards with fixed USDT denominations from $500 up to $50,000.
Implement a product catalog UI that lets users browse and select a gift card denomination and quantity, and calculates totals in USDT.
Implement a checkout flow that collects buyer contact details and presents Bitcoin payment instructions (Bitcoin payment acceptance) for the order.
Add a minimal admin screen (no external auth required) to review orders and update order status manually (e.g., mark as Paid/Delivered) after verifying Bitcoin payment off-app.
Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a professional crypto storefront (avoid blue/purple), including consistent color palette, typography, button styles, and section layouts.
Add generated static image assets and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).
Fix the Checkout page so Bitcoin payment instructions reliably display immediately after a successful "Create Order & Get Payment Instructions" submission, even after the cart session is cleared.
Add clear error feedback when order creation fails (including when the backend actor is not initialized), ensuring users understand why payment instructions are not shown.

Apply a global 50% pricing rule so that the amount shown in Bitcoin payment instructions reflects half of the selected gift card USDT total (e.g., a $500 card charges $250 worth of BTC), consistently across Checkout success view and the Order Status page for pending-payment orders.

Restrict Admin Panel access so only the site owner can access admin routes and admin backend operations (listing all orders and updating order status). Use Internet Identity for owner authentication/authorization and show an English “Access denied” experience to non-owners.
Update the Catalog page UI to display each supported gift card denomination as its own separate product card (grid/list), rather than only a single product with a denomination dropdown.

On each denomination product card in the catalog, display the specific 50% (half) price directly under the denomination in both USDT and BTC (English text), using the same discount and BTC conversion logic currently used by Checkout so the numbers match app-wide.

Expand the catalog’s supported denomination set to include additional denominations explicitly mentioned by the user (at minimum: 800 and 2000 USDT) so they appear as separate product cards and can be purchased through the existing checkout flow.

Replace the fixed BTC/USDT conversion (currently hardcoded as `BTC_TO_USDT_RATE = 45000`) with a real-time BTC↔USDT exchange rate fetched from a public price API, and use that rate to compute the BTC equivalent everywhere the app displays or submits BTC amounts (catalog denomination cards, checkout order creation + payment instructions, and order status page). All user-facing text related to exchange rates must be in English.

Expand the supported gift card denomination set to include additional high-tier values requested by the user so they appear as separate product cards and can be purchased via the existing checkout flow: 15,000; 20,000; 30,000; 35,000; 40,000; 45,000 USDT.

Improve the visual design of the denomination product cards to be more aesthetically polished and explicitly label each card as a “Binance Gift Card” or “Binance Gift Card / Voucher” (English), while keeping the existing selection behavior and pricing details (50% USDT and BTC equivalent).

Update the visual styling of the separate denomination product cards (and closely related catalog UI) to match a Binance Gift Card-like theme (Binance-style look and feel), while keeping all existing selection behavior, pricing (50% discount), and real-time BTC conversion logic unchanged.

Ensure the BTC equivalent shown on each denomination product card is computed using the same real-time BTC↔USDT exchange rate that is displayed in the UI, so the BTC amount is not “self-added”/stale and matches the current market rate used across the app.

Fix the Checkout flow error when the user clicks “Create Order & Get Payment Instructions” by ensuring order creation only runs when the backend actor is ready, and by surfacing a clear English error message when the actor is unavailable or the backend traps.
Update the frontend admin-route gating UX to help the real owner self-resolve 'Access Denied' when the backend has no owner configured yet, using only English user-facing text.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a professional e-commerce website for selling Binance Gift Cards (USDT denominations $500–$50,000) with Bitcoin payment acceptance.
Create backend order storage and basic order status tracking (e.g., Pending Payment, Paid, Delivered, Cancelled) in the single Motoko main actor.
Apply a 50% pricing rule so Bitcoin payment instructions show half of the selected gift card’s USDT value (e.g., $500 card charges $250 equivalent in BTC) for all denominations.
Restrict Admin Panel access to owner-only (add authentication/authorization so only the site owner can access admin features).

Show each gift card denomination as a separate product card in the catalog, and display its specific half-price (50% of USDT value) under the card, including the equivalent BTC amount (e.g., $500 card shows $250 in BTC).
Fix BTC amount calculation so the displayed half-price (e.g., $250) is converted to BTC using a real-time exchange rate (not a static/non-updating conversion).
Expand supported gift card denominations to include higher tiers (e.g., 15,000; 20,000; 30,000; 35,000; 40,000; 45,000 USDT) as selectable/purchasable product cards.
Improve the visual design of individual denomination product cards and explicitly label them as Binance Gift Card/Voucher for a more professional, authentic storefront presentation.
Update the catalog’s separate denomination product cards to use a Binance Gift Card-like visual theme (Binance-style branding/theme for the cards/UI).
Persist a single site-owner Principal in the Motoko backend and use it as the source of truth for admin authorization, so the owner can access admin-only APIs reliably after upgrades/redeploys.

Add backend APIs to (1) read the currently configured owner principal and (2) allow a one-time ownership claim when no owner is configured yet, so the real owner can resolve an 'Access Denied' situation without redeploying.

projectName: Professional website to sell Binance Gift Cards (USDT $500–$50,000) with Bitcoin payments
